title.narrative: Provision of education and child-protection life-saving assistance through preparedness and first line response in favor of conflict-affected children in Ninewa Governorate.

description.narrative: Based on the analysis of the current situation and the experience gained in Iraq, INTERSOS intends to extend its education programme to contribute towards enhancing access to quality education that incorporate child protection issues, increasing access to safe and protected educational environment for girls and boys, across Ninewa Governorate (in particular Hamdanyya district). These areas are currently concerned by prolonged displacement and, with the intensification of the military operations in West Mosul, an increase in the number of IDPs is expected, together with the number of people in need of assistance. The overarching objective of the intervention is to guarantee the effective continuation of the activities already started and to expand the scope of EiE and CP activities, capitalizing on lesson learnt and good practices. The proposed intervention focused mainly on ensuring first line education in emergency response in camp setting (Hasansham M2 and Salamya), in close complementarity with child protection activities, based on a mobile approach aiming at reaching also out of camps locations that are currently underserved and, if needed and with the due security clearance, mustering points. Specifically, through the establishment of TLSs and mobile child protection activities, the project aims at continuing to help children returning to a normal routine, contributing to the child’s emotional security and positive cognitive and physical development. 2 TLSs have already been established in Hasansham M2, and one TLS in Salamiya 1 camp the present proposal wants to maintain the 3 mentioned TLS and add a second TLS in Salamya 1 camp, as discussed with the Education Cluster. Targeted beneficiaries will include: girls and boys aged between 4 and 17 years old among displaced, including newly displaced people, and/or newly accessible people (returnees and/or remainees). Disabilities, minorities, age and gender will be taken into consideration throughout this proposed intervention.
